description: From hetero- +‎ zygote. Coined by English biologists William Bateson  and Edith Rebecca Saunders in 1902, in a paper titled "The facts of heredity in the light of Mendel’s discovery".

entries.meaning: (genetics) A diploid individual that has different alleles at one or more genetic loci.
(biology) A bacteriophage that has two different copies of its genetic material and so produces two types of offspring.
